emuInput.TitMainTitle: Soldiers from 372nd Infantry marching in parade, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
emuInput.PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Supreme safety film
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, July 11, 1942, pg. 14, reads: "Pittsburghers Hail Fighting Men from New York's 372nd Infantry and Fort Riley's Ninth Calvary - Pittsburgh was full of military spirit over the holidays when members of two famous colored units of the United States Army participated in colorful displays of military routine... Lower right: M. Loften and his officer aids [illegible] at the head of the [ill.] of the troops at another point in parade. Harris [illegible] photos."
